title: Iced Coffee Glass Nails Is The Luxe Manicure Everyoneâ€™s About To Copy
text:
Iced Coffee Glass Nails Is The Luxe Manicure Everyoneâ€™s About To Copy

An in-depth scroll of my camera roll would reveal nothing scandalousÂ â€”Â just an alarming quantity ofÂ nail inspiration.Â No, really.Â I have moreÂ screenshotsÂ ofÂ blue suede nails,Â polka dot prints, andÂ argyleÂ sweater-inspiredÂ manicuresÂ than IÂ haveÂ photos of my friends and family.Â Â 

My obsession withÂ nail artÂ puts me in a strong position toÂ identifyÂ the coolest emerging trends, and if you ask me, nothing is quite as mesmerizing as what manicurists are calling â€œiced coffee glassâ€ nails.Â 

What areÂ iced coffee glass nails,Â and how do you get the look?Â 

Also known as â€œribbed glassâ€ nails, the look is inspired by the dainty coffee glasses currently dominating Pinterest and the feeds of your favorite lifestyle brands.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Elizabeth | Miami nail tech (@nailedxeliz)

Session manicuristÂ Ami StreetsÂ says iced coffee glass nails are so popularÂ right nowÂ because they tap into what she calls the soft luxury aesthetic. â€œAmplified by social media and satisfying magnetic effects, iced coffee nails feel modern, elevated, and luxurious,â€ says Streets. She explains that itÂ blends multiple major trends:Â â€œThinkÂ glazed andÂ glass finishes, as well asÂ magnetic manicures,â€Â she says,Â essentially cat-eyeÂ polish, whichÂ containsÂ magnetic particles that are maneuvered into place with a magnet before it cures.Â 

While ribbed glass nails come in a variety of shades, one color paletteÂ seems to beÂ reigning supreme:Â â€œBrown tones have been a dominant trending color and are set to continue as a key colorÂ movementÂ in 2026,â€ says Streets.Â â€œThe warm neutrals paired with aÂ glossy,Â translucent sheen create depth and movement that mimics coffee in a glass.â€Â Weâ€™re just a little bit in love with these espresso nails courtesy of @Nails_ByLes on Instagram.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğğšğ¢ğ¥ğ¬ğğ²ğ‹ğğ¬ (@nails_byles)

How doÂ youÂ achieve iced coffee glass nails?Â 

Though this manicure might look complicated, an experienced nail artist will know exactly what to do. Streets explains, â€œTo create iced coffee glass nails with a ribbed-glass effect, start with a sheer brown gel base in latte, caramel, or iced-coffee tones.â€Â She adds that your nail tech will layerÂ the polishÂ according to your opacity preference.Â â€œOne to two thin coats will be more translucent rather than opaque, or for added depth, you can layer a subtle magnetic brown or taupe gel and softly activate the magnet to create gentle movement that mimics liquid in a glass.â€Â 

The next step is sealing in the cat-eye color with a high-shineÂ top coat, curing it under a UV lamp, and then applying aÂ matteÂ top coatÂ over the entire nail. â€œThis will help achieve that frosted, iced glass finish,â€ says Streets.Â 

Now for theÂ finishing touch: once bothÂ top coatsÂ are cured, a clear builder gel or thick clearÂ top coatÂ is used to draw raised vertical lines, Streets explains. â€œThese extend from the cuticle to the free edge and should be evenly spaced to resemble ribbed drinking glasses,â€ she says. The nails are then fully cured. â€œThe glossy lines will appear raised while the rest of the nail remains matte,â€ says Streets, â€œand itâ€™s the contrast between soft-focus glass and high-shine ribs that gives this manicure an elevated, dimensional finish.â€Â 

Because there are quite a few steps,Â donâ€™tÂ expect this to be a quickÂ salon visit. Iced glass nails can take a couple of hours in the salon chair, as moving the magnetic particles into place to make the finish look like liquid takes time and precision. Your nails might take even longer ifÂ youâ€™reÂ opting for a builder gel or hard gel base, which requires extra layering and curing.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Vacaville, CA | BIANCA (@allthingsbybb)

The best iced coffee glass nail inspiration on Instagram:Â Â 

Coffee and nude tones might be de rigueur among ribbed glass nail obsessives, but there are no rules when it comes to choosing a shade. Ahead, find the best ribbed glass nail inspiration in a variety ofÂ different colors.Â 

Antique GlassÂ Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by GOOSE (@goose.beauty)

Nail salon GooseÂ takes cues from alchemy, inspired by the deep green potion bottles of centuries past. We love this high voltage hueÂ â€” a cat-eye polish that looks as though it has been painted over aÂ jet-blackÂ base to really pop.Â 

Magenta GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Nailporn (@nailporn)

WeÂ canâ€™tÂ take our eyes away from these multidimensional magenta nails byÂ Nail Porn, which gleam in purple, pink, and orange as the light shifts.Â 

Fire GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Lilly | Denver Nail Artist (@the.lillyedit)

Denver-basedÂ nail artist LillyÂ makes these glass nails flicker like a burning fireplace, layering burnt orange cat-eye polish over a black base.Â 

Sea GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Clarisa Maldonado (@nailskiezzbyclari)

Hazy sea glass inspires these blue-green nails byÂ Clarisa Maldonado, where a glossyÂ top coatÂ over cat-eye polish and delicate silvery lines make them catch the light from every angle.Â 

Wine Glass

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ari | licensed nail technician (@thecuticlecove)

Licensed nail technician AriÂ shows how to elevate a classic burgundy, pairing a matte base with sleek, glossy stripes.Â 

Champagne GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğŸ’…ğŸ½ ğ–ğ–”ğ–šğ–— ğ–’ğ–†ğ–šğ– ğ–“ğ–†ğ–ğ–‘ ğ–Œğ–ğ–—ğ–‘ âœ¨ (@mayleidoesnails)

Nail artist @mayleidoesnailsÂ usedÂ structured gelÂ â€” a harder, more durable gel â€” to createÂ these twinkling, champagne-esqueÂ glass nails.Â 

Azure GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Elizabeth | Miami nail tech (@nailedxeliz)

Miami nail tech Elizabethâ€˜s take on the glass manicureÂ brings to mindÂ boat trips on the Mediterranean. TheÂ top coatÂ stripes make the dark blueÂ cat-eyeÂ polish appear azure in places.Â Â 

Midnight GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Gel X By shirel ash (@manisbyash)

Shirel Ash plays with a dark base, silver cat-eye polish, and ultra-fineÂ top coatÂ lines to create a look that evokes a starry midnight sky.Â

A post shared by ğ™ğ™˜ğ™–ğ™§ğ™¡ğ™šğ™©ğ™ (@scaviar.nails)

The light bounces beautifully off these golden-brown nails by Scarleth, and the almond shape is the cherry on top.

Violet GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Beth | Nail Technician (@nailsby_bjp_)

The Gel Bottleâ€™s cat-eye polish in Vault is behind this violet-meets-silver set byÂ nail technician Beth.Â Weâ€™reÂ taking this one to our nail salon, stat.Â Â 

Iced AmericanoÂ

A range of coffee-toned shades come together in this manicure byÂ JustÂ LolsÂ Nails, with stripesÂ renderedÂ in a deeper hue rather than a clearÂ top coat, adding layers and dimension.Â

title: Buckle Up! Venus In Aquarius Is Going To Be A Bumpy Ride
text:
Buckle Up! Venus In Aquarius Is Going To Be A Bumpy Ride

AsÂ expected, Venus in Aquarius is going to shake up our world in unpredictable and erratic ways â€” so buckle up because the ride is about to get bumpy from January 17thÂ to February 10th. The planet of social connections and romance is often more methodical, open-minded, and progressive whenÂ it comes toÂ the lastÂ Air sign of the zodiacÂ â€” andÂ thatâ€™sÂ notÂ a bad thing.Â Â 

DuringÂ this time, relationships can become unconventional, which means thatÂ weâ€™reÂ more open to seeking different qualities in a partner or making advances towards commitment in unique ways. Fundamentally, we are looking to connect with like-minded people, while also enjoying debates and meetings with opposingÂ views.Â Basically, itâ€™sÂ not a boring transit!Â 

Venus in Aquarius is going to share a harsh aspect with Uranus retrograde in Taurus. The square betweenÂ bothÂ planets is going to be wild becauseÂ weâ€™llÂ wish to relinquish relationships or friendships thatÂ donâ€™tÂ appeal to us anymore. TheÂ caveatÂ is that we willÂ probably wantÂ to get back together with these people several times in between the end of Venus in Aquariusâ€™s stint, soÂ donâ€™tÂ say words or be a part of actions that youÂ canâ€™tÂ take back or apologize for. The situationshipÂ youâ€™veÂ been a part of might end on your accord, only for you to send a late-night text days later to reignite it. The back and forth might be dizzying, butÂ itâ€™sÂ par for the course. Also, think twice before blocking or unfollowing. The same applies here, too.Â 

Take note:Â Venus in Aquarius is bringingÂ healing energy, too. Although we are going to feel likeÂ weâ€™reÂ on a roller coaster ride throughout the journey, we are gaining knowledge and help from the community and world at large to help us mend our wounds and trauma. It is a glorious time to seek advice and wisdom from others to get clarity on what we want to focus on and grow.Â IfÂ we pay tribute to thoseÂ whoâ€™veÂ inspired and motivated us, we will pay the sentiment forward and gain insight that we can spread to others.Â Â 

Remember the water bearer takesÂ great joyÂ from imparting its knowledge to the universe andÂ assistingÂ those it cares about. TheÂ caveatÂ is that they have an aloof way of showing it. The reason is that Aquarius is the watery part ofÂ Air, so it has the emotion and intuition that all water signsÂ possess, and they express it straightforwardly and concisely, like anÂ Air sign. IfÂ youâ€™reÂ looking for declarations of love, thisÂ isnâ€™tÂ the time for that. But ifÂ youâ€™reÂ looking for companionship, loyalty, flirtations, and camaraderie, then Venus in Aquarius will aid you in that capacity.Â 

A great placeÂ to meet a potential romantic partner is on dating apps. Venus in Aquarius is a tech-savvy individual, making it an ideal spot for those seeking love. Rather than spend a night on the town with a friend or significant other, take that cash and donate it to a philanthropic organization that is meaningful to you.Â 

Important Astrological Dates:Â 

January 17th: Venus enters Aquarius, pushing us to be demure and logical when it comes to our affections.Â 

January 19th: Venus forms a conjunction with Pluto in Aquarius, spicing up our desires and jealousies. Arguments are popping off due to triangular situations and power struggles. The temperature may be cold outside, but that isÂ notÂ the case behind closed doors.Â 

February 4th: Venus in Aquarius harmonizes with the centaur Chiron in Aries, urging us to evolve our bodies, minds, and spirits. We hold the key to our own healing.Â 

February 8th: Venus in AquariusÂ squares UranusÂ retrograde in Taurus, allowing us to break out of unhealthy or stagnant situations that are holding us back from living our most authentic lives.Â 

February 10th: Venus swims into Pisces for the next few weeks, allowing us to accept others and ourselves for who we truly are â€” no strings attached.Â

title: Winter Dress Trends â€” Like Plaid & Capes â€” To Wear All Season Long
text:
Winter Dress Trends â€” Like Plaid & Capes â€” To Wear All Season Long

Frost is nipping at our noses â€” which means our winter dress coats and knee-high boots are officially back in rotation. As your winter dresses make their seasonal debut, itâ€™s the perfect time to refresh a few favorites.

This season especially calls for long-sleeve dresses across cozy knit and velvet fabrics, elevated blazer and cape designs, plus bundled-up high-neck and maxi silhouettes. Many of these trendy winter dresses can be worn for everything from work to winter weddings (and all the celebrations throughout the season, like Valentineâ€™s Day). And we promise that plaids and velvets are way more versatile than just being worn for the holidays.

Ahead, shop the best cool-weather picks to achieve trendy winter aesthetics from reader-favorite retailers like Nordstrom, Free People, and H&M.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Sweater Dresses

Whether youâ€™re dressing for the office, a cozy dinner, a log cabin getaway, or a window-shopping stroll, itâ€™s time to embrace sweater weather. From plush cashmere and merino wool to ribbed jersey knits, these sweater dresses are equal parts warm and comfortable. We found styles in a range of lengths with turtlenecks, belts, and cardigan-esque designs that arenâ€™t so basic, yet still versatile.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Velvet Dresses

When it comes to winter fabrics, velvet is the undisputed favorite. Itâ€™s soft, tactile, and undeniably luxe â€” perfect for winter cocktail parties, especially when in drapey silhouettes. For other seasonal occasions, like date nights, weâ€™ve also spotted darling mini dresses with playful details like sequins and lace for extra texture and interest.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Plaid Dresses

Just as classic plaid coats are trending, so are plaid dresses. While gingham shines in the warmer months, slightly festive and edgy plaids and tartans in deep color combos are perfect throughout the winter. So, whether youâ€™re looking to re-style your favorite holiday dresses or are shopping for a new dress, plaid is your friend. Find the print across mini, midi, and maxi lengths for every vibe and occasion.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Blazer Dresses

Continuing the 2025 fashion trend train, bold shoulders and soft suiting are still popular, so itâ€™s no wonder blazer dresses are having a moment. This suit alternative lets you bring the business vibes while showing a bit of leg. Plus, thicker velvet and faux leather fabrics, as well as details like neck scarves, mean you donâ€™t have to sacrifice warmth. Just add fleece-lined tights and over-the-knee boots to fully winter-proof your look.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Cape Dresses

Weâ€™ve been seeing cape dresses more frequently, especially across awards season red carpets, so weâ€™re embracing the celebrity-backed trend. Ethereal sheer capes, attached scarves, and removable sleeves are especially popping up across our favorite retailers. Cape dresses make for the ideal winter wedding guest style, especially if youâ€™re looking for a little extra coverage and warmth, sans stiff or sweaty long sleeves.

DashDividers_1_500x100

High-Neck Dresses

This awards season has also highlighted high-neck gowns, which is perhaps surprising, but certainly seasonally appropriate. From turtlenecks and mock necks to cowl necks and boatnecks, these dresses are reserved, but still chic and flirty. And luckily, thereâ€™s a range of fabrics and lengths that are perfect for professional work settings, casual family gatherings, romantic date nights, and black-tie parties.

title: The Lesser-Known Acid Skincare Experts Love For A Year-Round Glow
text:
The Lesser-Known Acid Skincare Experts Love For A Year-Round Glow

If I were to rifle through your currentÂ skincare lineup,Â Iâ€™dÂ betÂ Iâ€™dÂ find at least one of the following:Â salicylic acid,Â glycolic acid, orÂ lactic acid. Thanks to brands likeÂ The Ordinary, Paulaâ€™s Choice,Â andÂ Drunk Elephant,Â exfoliating acids have become staples in many routines.Â (Donâ€™tÂ ask me to pick a favorite â€”Â Iâ€™mÂ loyal to all three.)Â From unclogging pores to fading hyperpigmentation and brightening dull skin, their benefits are well documented, butÂ thereâ€™sÂ anotherÂ acidÂ quietlyÂ vying forÂ your attention,Â and if you have sensitive skin,Â might just replace whatÂ youâ€™reÂ using now.Â 

Enter:Â citricÂ acid.Â 

What is citric acid,Â and how does it work in skincare?Â 

Mariam Abbas, an advanced facialist,Â says citric acid isÂ basically anÂ acid â€” specifically an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) â€” and it comes from citrus fruits, which is where it gets its name.Â 

â€œIn high enough concentrations, citric acid can have an exfoliating effect on the skin,â€ says Abbas. It encourages old or dead skin cells to shed, revealing fresh, new cells and improving the appearance of dull skin, Abbas explains. It can also help unclog pores and prevent new breakouts, but it does all of this with far less irritation: â€œCitric acid is gentler than other alpha hydroxy acids,â€ she says. This is because its larger moleculesÂ arenâ€™tÂ absorbed into the skin as easily as glycolic acidâ€™s much smaller ones. â€œAs such, it is better tolerated as an exfoliating agent by sensitive skin,â€ says Abbas.Â 

Is citric acid good for the skin?Â 

Besides gentle exfoliation, Abbas says citric acid also has anÂ antioxidant effectÂ on the skin, helping protect it from things like smoke and pollution that can cause dullness or congestion. Not only that, but it can also boost the effectiveness of other antioxidants like trustyÂ vitamin C: â€œIn this way, it can indirectly have a brightening effect on the skin when used in combination with actives like vitamin C,â€ explains Abbas.Â Thatâ€™sÂ whyÂ youÂ mightÂ spot it on the ingredient list of your favoriteÂ vitamin CÂ moisturizer or serum.Â Â 

How do you use citric acid in a skincare routine?Â 

Because citric acid is such a beneficial addition, it appears in a wide range of skincare products, but mostly exfoliators.Â More often than not, citric acid is combined with other exfoliating acids, like glycolic or lactic acid â€” both of which also brighten the skin, unclog pores, and minimize hyperpigmentation. Think of citric acid as the supporting actor in yourÂ exfoliatingÂ cleansers, toners, leave-on exfoliators, or serums.Â Â 

One of our favoriteÂ productsÂ â€” and a staple in manyÂ beautyÂ editorsâ€™ skin, hair, and body routines â€” isÂ The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Toner. While glycolic acid is the star ingredient, citric acid also smoothsÂ rough texture, boostsÂ radiance, and exfoliatesÂ skin. Top tip: It works just as well on aÂ flaky scalpÂ orÂ rough feetÂ as it does on your face.Â 

If leave-on toners tend to irritate your skin, consider aÂ wash-offÂ cleanser instead. Abbas recommendsÂ Skin Better Science Refining Foam Cleanser, which combines citric acid with gentle AHA lactic acid and BHA salicylic acid. The salicylic acid penetrates a little deeper into the pores to break up the glue-like mixture of oil and dead skin cells that can lead to breakouts. If you have less to spend, tryÂ TheÂ InkeyÂ Listâ€™s Salicylic Acid Cleanser, also with salicylicÂ and citric acids.Â 

Because citric acid has antioxidant benefits,Â youâ€™llÂ alsoÂ spot it inside plenty of brightening serumsÂ alongside vitamin C.Â TryÂ SkinfixÂ Barrier+ Serum with 15% vitamin CÂ and antioxidant ferulic acid, orÂ The Ordinaryâ€™s Multi-Antioxidant Radiance Serum, withÂ ascorbylÂ glucoside â€” a version of vitamin CÂ thatâ€™sÂ kinder on reactive skin.Â Â 

Are there any downsides to using citric acid in a skincare routine?Â 

Lastly,Â Abbas notes that, like any exfoliant, citric acid can cause dryness, irritation, or sensitivity if overused or used inÂ very highÂ concentrations. She adds thatÂ itâ€™sÂ also sometimes added as a fragrance in skincare, which could trigger allergic reactions or irritation in those with perfume-sensitive skin. If this sounds familiar,Â itâ€™sÂ always worthÂ patch-testingÂ any new skincare product before applying it to your face. Try the inner elbow, neck, or the area behind your ear.Â 

Explore our top citric acid skincare picks below.Â Â

title: We Did The Research & These Are The Best Golden Globes Looks Since 1989
text:
We Did The Research & These Are The Best Golden Globes Looks Since 1989 On Sunday, millions of people tuned into the 83rd Golden Globe Awards for the annual star-studded occasion and the official kickoff of this yearâ€™s awards season. And, of course, the red carpet fashion was all the talk.

In celebration of this red carpet's return, we're looking back decades to show off the best red carpet looks from each year between 2026 to 1989 â€” that is, except for 2008, when the Writers Guild of America went on strike and the whole event was canceled, and 2022, when backlash against the Hollywood Foreign Press put the award ceremony on hold.

title: The Best Moisturizers To Quench Thirsty Dry Skin
text:
The Best Moisturizers To Quench Thirsty Dry Skin It may not be as trendy as the latest PDRN serum or sleek gadget, but if there's one skincare step that's giving workhorse vibes, it's definitely moisturizer. From shielding skin from dry, cold weather to strengthening the skin barrier, proper hydration and moisture (which are two different things, both important: In layman's terms, hydration is more surface-level, lending an immediate softening, plumping effect to skin, while moisturizing locks in hydration via oils/butters to prevent evaporation.) is an essential step in your routine, and one worth investing in.

I personally learned (the hard way, might I add) that neglecting moisturizer is honestly, one of the worst things you can do to your skin. As an acne-prone gal, I spent more years than I'd care to admit robbing my face of hydration in the hopes it would curb my breakouts, when in reality, it only exacerbated them since my sebum production skyrocketed as a result of dehydration.

As beauty editors, we test hundreds of moisturizers a year, and as such, know a thing or two about the ones that actually work and the ones worth skipping. Ahead, the 12 best moisturizers for dry skin that really quenched our thirst.

At Refinery29, weâ€™re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. If you buy something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.

title: What To Activate in Yourself To Make 2026 Your Best Year Yet, According to Your Sign
text:

As you may know, 2026 is the Year of the Fire Horse. It represents a year that conjures boldness, movement, and the willingness to run toward what calls you without looking back for approval. But none of that happens by accident. It happens because you choose it. Because only you can activate the frequency within yourself that matches the life you say you want.

These tarotscopes arenâ€™t predictive; theyâ€™re channeled directions. Itâ€™s Spirit showing you exactly what needs to come alive inside of you to make this year everything you've been building toward. This is your roadmap to alignment. title: 12 Elevated Hair Color Trends To Inspire Your Next Salon Visit In 2026
text:
12 Elevated Hair Color Trends To Inspire Your Next Salon Visit In 2026

As youÂ plan meticulouslyÂ for the year ahead, spare a thought for the colorists of the world, who often have only â€œblondeâ€ or â€œbrunetteâ€ to go on when clients walk through the door.Â 

Thatâ€™sÂ whyÂ theyâ€™veÂ spent the first few days of January dreaming up every shade imaginable toÂ showcaseÂ theÂ manyÂ nuances of hair tones.Â (If last yearâ€™sÂ cowgirl copperÂ stole your heart,Â youâ€™reÂ going to fall for 2026â€™s apricot blonde.)Â
